docs.title: About This Portfolio
docs.text: This portfolio documents my learning journey through the Modelling and Fabrication Techniques course offered by FabLab Rwanda in partnership with UR-ACEIoT. Throughout this course, I explore the intersection of digital design, electronics, and physical fabrication—skills essential for modern IoT system development.

docs.title: Course Topics
docs.text:
📚 Foundation

Documentation practices, version control with Git/GitHub, and establishing professional workflows for technical projects.

Explore Foundation → 🎨 Digital Design

3D modeling with FreeCAD, 2D vector graphics with Inkscape, and design-for-manufacturing principles for real-world production.

Explore Design → ⚡ Electronics

PCB design fundamentals, microcontroller circuits, KiCad workflows, and preparing designs for fabrication through milling.

Explore Electronics → 🔧 Manufacturing

Material selection, fabrication methods (CNC, laser cutting, 3D printing), and understanding the relationship between design and production.

Explore Manufacturing →

docs.title: Course Structure
docs.text:
Foundation: Documentation & Web Development

Establishing professional documentation practices using MkDocs, Git, and GitHub Pages.

Digital Design: CAD & Vector Graphics

Learning parametric 3D modeling and precision 2D design for fabrication.

Electronics: PCB Design & Fabrication

Designing functional circuits for microcontroller-based IoT systems.

Manufacturing: Materials & Methods

Exploring material properties and fabrication techniques for physical prototypes.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This section covers the fundamental skills for professional technical documentation and version control. These practices are essential for any engineering project, enabling collaboration, reproducibility, and knowledge sharing.

docs.title: Learning Objectives
docs.text:
• Set up and configure MkDocs with Material theme
  • Implement Git version control workflows
  • Deploy static sites using GitHub Pages
  • Create clear, structured technical documentation

docs.title: Tools & Technologies
docs.text:
• MkDocs - Static site generator
  • Material for MkDocs - Modern documentation theme
  • Git - Version control system
  • GitHub - Code hosting and collaboration platform
  • GitHub Actions - CI/CD automation

docs.title: Why This Matters
docs.text: Good documentation is not an afterthought—it's an integral part of the design process. For IoT systems, where hardware, software, and firmware interact, clear documentation ensures that designs are reproducible, maintainable, and scalable.

docs.title: Documentation as a Learning Tool
docs.text:
Throughout this course, documentation serves multiple purposes:

  1. Process Recording - Capturing design decisions and iterations
  2. Knowledge Retention - Creating a personal reference library
  3. Portfolio Building - Showcasing technical capabilities
  4. Peer Learning - Sharing insights with classmates

Course Context

This foundation module corresponds to Day 1 activities from the FabLab Rwanda course, focusing on establishing professional documentation practices.

docs.title: Documentation Setup with MkDocs
docs.text:
Activity Overview

Duration: 2-3 hours Tools: Python, MkDocs Material, Text Editor Deliverable: Functional documentation website

docs.title: Objective
docs.text: Create a professional technical documentation website using MkDocs with the Material theme. This forms the foundation for documenting all fabrication activities throughout the course.

docs.title: What You'll Learn
docs.text:
• Installing and configuring MkDocs Material
  • Understanding markdown syntax and structure
  • Organizing documentation with hierarchical navigation
  • Customizing themes and styling
  • Running local preview server

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Ensure you have Python 3.x installed:

```bash python --version ```

docs.title: Install MkDocs Material
docs.text: ```bash pip install mkdocs-material ```

docs.title: Initialize MkDocs Project
docs.text:
```bash mkdocs new fabrication-portfolio cd fabrication-portfolio ```

This creates:

``` fabrication-portfolio/ ├── docs/ │ └── index.md └── mkdocs.yml ```

docs.title: Basic mkdocs.yml
docs.text: ```yaml site_name: My Fabrication Portfolio theme: name: material palette: primary: blue accent: amber ```

docs.title: Complete Navigation Structure
docs.text: ```yaml nav: - Home: index.md - Foundation: - foundation/index.md - Documentation Setup: foundation/documentation-setup.md - Digital Design: - design/index.md - Electronics: - electronics/index.md - Manufacturing: - manufacturing/index.md ```

docs.title: Start Development Server
docs.text:
```bash mkdocs serve ```

Visit: http://127.0.0.1:8000

The server auto-reloads when you save changes.

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text: ``` docs/ ├── index.md # Home page ├── foundation/ │ ├── index.md │ ├── documentation-setup.md │ └── github-pages.md ├── design/ │ ├── index.md │ └── freecad-bracket.md ├── electronics/ │ ├── index.md │ └── attiny45-project.md ├── manufacturing/ │ ├── index.md │ └── materials.md ├── images/ │ ├── logos/ │ ├── foundation/ │ ├── design/ │ ├── electronics/ │ └── manufacturing/ └── stylesheets/ └── extra.css ```

docs.text:

  • Configure color palette

docs.title: Task 4: Test Locally
docs.text:
• Run mkdocs serve
  • Verify all pages load correctly
  • Test navigation links
  • Check responsive design

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Problem: mkdocs: command not found Solution: Ensure Python and pip are in your PATH

Problem: Theme not loading Solution: Verify theme: name: material in mkdocs.yml

Problem: Images not displaying Solution: Check relative paths from markdown file location

docs.title: Writing Good Documentation
docs.text:
1. Be Specific - Include exact steps, not general descriptions
  2. Add Screenshots - Visual aids clarify complex processes
  3. Explain Why - Don't just document what, explain rationale
  4. Include Files - Provide download links for design files
  5. Update Regularly - Document as you work, not after
